comment.author: 29809546@N00
comment._content:
Two things which strike me:
1. The longing look of the young lady 2nd from right
2. The contrasting expressions of the lads sitting cross-legged


A lovely photo.

comment._content: A dashing bunch. Is that Mr.Hitler 3rd from right?!

comment.author: 16489083@N05
comment._content:
Surprised that two of the ladies were sitting on the wall...
seems in that day it would have been considered most 
unlady like... A fine looking group of young people and 
dressed most impressively... wonderful B&W group
 portrait capture... wonderful details and clarity!!!
comment.authorname: maorlando God kept us 2012 leaning on Him 2013

comment.author: 63163769@N00
comment._content: If it's just before 1pm, it must have been overcast, as the shadows are very soft. Excellent conditions for a group portrait. However , the photographer lined up the bottom of the frame with the shoes of the subjects on a slanted surface, making the image slightly askew. This slight lean is particularly noticeable in the man on the left. I have made a copy in which I corrected this flaw, cropped tighter and added a warm tone:

comment.author: 18713525@N00
comment._content: what a fabulous group portrait! -- Seen in my contacts' photos. ( ?² )

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/slimdandy] Thanks a mill, Bob! Warm tone is lovely...

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/24882261@N04] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/la_belle_province] If this hadn't been a Pic of the Day which means it has its date as a title, I would have called it Hats and Spats! Might have brought us a lot of people in search of gangster photos, who would have been disappointed...  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I must admit that I never saw a lady with spats before! Interesting shot with a whole lot going on, the young lady on the extreme right as you look at it is obviously looking at someone or thing inside the door.  The lady sitting with crossed legs (ladylike) is looking across but at whom? Adds an air of mystery to the story doesn't it?
